data.title: The 50 British films that inspired a young Martin Scorsese
data.meta_description: During lockdown, director Edgar Wright dug deep into the history of British cinema – guided by a letter from a living legend
data.text:
When the film-maker Edgar Wright told his hero Martin Scorsese he’d “always been curious as to what some of your favourite British films were growing up”, the great director responded with this list of mid-20th century gems.

Shooting Stars

Anthony Asquith (1927)

Underground

Anthony Asquith (1928)

Brief Ecstasy

Edmond T Gréville (1937)

Went the Day Well?

Alberto Cavalcanti (1942)

The Man in Grey

Leslie Arliss (1943)

The Halfway House

Basil Dearden (1944)

This Happy Breed

David Lean (1944)

The Seventh Veil

Compton Bennett (1945)

Dead of Night

Alberto Cavalcanti, Charles Crichton, Basil Dearden, Robert Hamer (1945)

Madonna of the Seven Moons

Arthur Crabtree (1945)

Pink String and Sealing Wax

Robert Hamer (1945)

Green for Danger

Sidney Gilliat (1946)

It Always Rains on Sunday

Robert Hamer (1947)

Uncle Silas

Charles Frank (1947)

Hue and Cry

Charles Crichton (1947)

To the Public Danger

Terence Fisher (1948)

The Queen of Spades

Thorold Dickinson (1949)

The Blue Lamp

Basil Dearden (1950)

So Long at the Fair

Terence Fisher, Antony Darnborough (1950)

The Sound Barrier

David Lean (1952)

Stolen Face

Terence Fisher (1952)

Mandy

Alexander Mackendrick (1952)

Spaceways

Terence Fisher (1953)

Four Sided Triangle

Terence Fisher (1953)

The Good Die Young

Lewis Gilbert (1954)

Yield to the Night

J Lee Thompson (1956)

Nowhere to Go

Seth Holt (1958)

The Snorkel

Guy Green (1958)

Sapphire

Basil Dearden (1959)

The Flesh and the Fiends

John Gilling (1960)

Taste of Fear

Seth Holt (1961)

The Innocents

Jack Clayton (1961)

Station Six Sahara

Seth Holt (1962)

Night of the Eagle

Sidney Hayers (1962)

The Damned

Joseph Losey (1963)

The Mindbenders

Basil Dearden (1963)

The Pumpkin Eater

Jack Clayton (1964)

Guns at Batasi

John Guillermin (1964)

The Nanny

Seth Holt (1965)

A High Wind in Jamaica

Alexander Mackendrick (1965)

Plague of the Zombies

John Gilling (1966)

Quatermass and the Pit

Roy Ward Baker (1967)

Whistle and I’ll Come To You

Jonathan Miller (1968)

The Devil Rides Out

Terence Fisher (1968)

Dr Jekyll and Sister Hyde

Roy Ward Baker (1971)

The Asphyx

Peter Newbrook (1972)

The Legend of Hell House

John Hough (1973)

Vampyres

José Ramón Larraz (1974)

The Long Good Friday

John Mackenzie (1980)
